snippet: An important new study based on capital cases in Connecticut provides powerful evidence that death sentences are haphazardly meted out.
abstract: Editorial highlights a new study based on capital cases in Connecticut, which provides powerful evidence that death sentences are haphazardly meted out, with virtually no connection to the heinousness of the crime; asserts that the death penalty in Connecticut is clearly unconstitutional and should be abolished, as it should be everywhere.
lead_paragraph: An important new study based on capital cases in Connecticut provides powerful evidence that death sentences are haphazardly meted out.

headline.main: The Random Horror of the Death Penalty
headline.print_headline: The Random Horror Of the Death Penalty
